decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be for a temporary period of three (3) years only starting from the date of this decision after which time the building and the associated equipment shall be removed and the land re-instated.

Reason: The siting of a temporary building is such that the Local Planning Authority is only prepared to grant permission for a limited period to ensure the success of the site as a public open space. The limitation of the consent period ensures compliance with policy D3 of the London Plan (2021) and section 57(2) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers:

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall be in accordance with those described in the hereby approved drawings listed in Condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), Policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 19) and the NPPF (2023).
| The hereby approved development shall operate solely within the following hours: Tuesday to Friday 16:00 to 20:00; and with a maximum occupancy of 15 people.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| At no time shall any external door nor windows be fixed in an open position during the emission of smell, smoke, fumes or loud noise.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
